member.name: T:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.EncryptionKeySize
member.summary: The length of the encryption key

member.name: T:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.PdfDocumentInfo
member.summary: This class encapsulates the options to control the merged PDF document description (author, title, keywords, etc). The PDFMerge class defines a reference to an object of this type

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.PdfDocumentInfo.AuthorName
member.summary: Gets or sets name of the document author.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.PdfDocumentInfo.CreatedDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the date and time when the document was created.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.PdfDocumentInfo.Application
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the application that produced this document

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.PdfDocumentInfo.Subject
member.summary: Gets or sets the subject of the document.

member.name: T:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.PdfSecurityOptions
member.summary: This class encapsulates the options to control the security options of the merged PDF document. The PDFMerge class defines a reference to an object of this type

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.PdfSecurityOptions.CanAssembleDocument
member.summary: Can assemble the document (create bookmarks, thumbnail images or insert, rotate, delete pages). This property has effect when a 128 bit key is used.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.PdfSecurityOptions.CanFillFormFields
member.summary: Can fill the form fields. This property has effect when a 128 bit key is used. To disable form filling the CanEditContent and CanEditAnnotations must be set on false.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.PdfSecurityOptions.KeySize
member.summary: The dimension of the encryption key. By default a 128 bit key is used.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.PdfSecurityOptions.OwnerPassword
member.summary: The password required to change permissions of the PDF document like printing or editing. If the OwnerPassword property is an empty string and the UserPassword is not empty, the OwnerPassword will be automatically assigned with the value from UserPassword and when the PDF document is opened in the viewer using the user password (which is also the owner password) all the operations like printing, copying, etc will be allowed.

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.PdfSecurityOptions.UserPassword
member.summary: The password required to open the PDF document. If the OwnerPassword property is an empty string and the UserPassword is not empty, the OwnerPassword will be automatically assigned with the value from UserPassword and when the PDF document is opened in the viewer using the user password (which is also the owner password) all the operations like printing, copying, etc will be allowed.

member.name: T:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.RenderImageFormatConverter
member.summary: This class converts a MergeImageFormat to System.Drawing.ImageFormat

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.RenderImageFormatConverter.GetImageFormat(ExpertPdf.MergePdf.MergeImageFormat)
member.param: The MergeImageFormat to convert

member.name: T:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.MergePDFException
member.summary: The type of exceptions thrown by the library

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.MergePDFException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.param: The exception message
The exception which produced this exception

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.PDFCompressionLevel.AboveNormal
member.summary: Better compression but takes more time to compress

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.PDFCompressionLevel.BelowNormal
member.summary: Something middle between normal and BestSpeed compressions

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.PDFCompressionLevel.Best
member.summary: Use the best compression but takes more time to compress

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.PDFCompressionLevel.BestSpeed
member.summary: The compression speed is high but the compression percentage is low

member.name: F:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.PDFCompressionLevel.Normal
member.summary: Use normal compression, a balance between compression speed and resulted size

member.name: T:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.PdfDocumentOptions
member.summary: This class encapsulates the options to control the PDF document redering process. The PDFMerge class define a reference to an object of this type

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.PdfDocumentOptions.PdfPageOrientation
member.summary: This property controls the PDF page orientation

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.PdfDocumentOptions.PdfCompressionLevel
member.summary: This property controls the compression level of the rendered PDF document

member.name: P:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.PdfDocumentOptions.PdfPageSize
member.summary: This property controls the size of the rendered PDF document

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.PDFMerge.#ctor
member.summary: Merge using default PDF document options

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.PDFMerge.#ctor(ExpertPdf.MergePdf.PdfDocumentOptions)
member.summary: Merge using the specified PDF document options

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.PDFMerge.AppendPDFFile(System.String)
member.param: The full file path of the existing PDF document

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.PDFMerge.AppendPDFFile(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Appends pages from the specified source document starting from zero based page index in the source document.
member.param: The full path of the document to be appended
The zero based index of the page from the source document from where to start appending pages

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.PDFMerge.AppendPDFFile(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Appends at most length pages from the specified source document starting from zero based index startIndex in the source document.
member.param: The full path of the document to be appended
The zero based index of the page from the source document from where to start appending pages

The number of pages to be taken from the source document and appended to the merged document. If the specified length is bigger than the available number of pages starting from the specified start page index, only the available number of pages will be appended.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.PDFMerge.AppendPDFFile(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Appends at most length pages from the specified password protected source document starting from zero based index startIndex in the source document.
member.param: The full path of the document to be appended
The password to open the appended document. If this argument is null no password will be used.
The zero based index of the page from the source document from where to start appending pages

The number of pages to be taken from the source document and appended to the merged document. If the specified length is bigger than the available number of pages starting from the specified start page index, only the available number of pages will be appended. If the length is negative e.g -1, all the PDF pages available from startIndex will be appended to the merged document.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.PDFMerge.AppendEmptyPage
member.summary: Appends an empty page to PDF document

member.summary: Appends a PDF stream to the merged document
member.param: The PDF stream to be appended

member.summary: Appends pages from the specified source document starting from zero based page index in the source document.
member.param: The PDF stream to be appended
The zero based index of the page from the source document from where to start appending pages

member.summary: Appends at most length pages from the specified source document starting from zero based index startIndex in the source document.
member.param: The PDF stream to be appended
The zero based index of the page from the source document from where to start appending pages

The number of pages to be taken from the source document and appended to the merged document. If the specified length is bigger than the available number of pages starting from the specified start page index, only the available number of pages will be appended.

member.name: M:ExpertPdf.MergePdf.PDFMerge.AppendPDFStream(System.IO.Stream,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Appends at most length pages from the specified password protected source document starting from zero based index startIndex in the source document.
member.param: The PDF stream to be appended
The password to open the appended document. If this argument is null no password will be used.
The zero based index of the page from the source document from where to start appending pages

The number of pages to be taken from the source document and appended to the merged document. If the specified length is bigger than the available number of pages starting from the specified start page index, only the available number of pages will be appended. If the length is negative e.g -1, all the PDF pages available from startIndex will be appended to the merged document.
